option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"G:/Office Project/LocationTracking":"{\"/app/src/androidTest/java/com/example/locationtracking/ExampleInstrumentedTest.kt\":\"This file contains an instrumented test for an Android app called \\\"LocationTracking\\\". It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test case that checks if the app\\u0027s context is correctly set up.\\n\\n`ExampleInstrumentedTest`: This is an instrumented test class that runs on an Android device and checks if the app\\u0027s package name is correct.\\n\\n`useAppContext()`: This test function checks if the app\\u0027s context is correctly set up by asserting that the package name of the app under test is \\\"com.example.locationtracking\\\".\",\"/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a top-level build file that sets up common configuration options for all sub-projects or modules in the Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather sets up the necessary plugins for the Android application and Kotlin Android development.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n\\n1. Applies the Android application plugin to all sub-projects/modules.\\n2. Applies the Kotlin Android plugin to all sub-projects/modules.\",\"/app/src/test/java/com/example/locationtracking/ExampleUnitTest.kt\":\"This file contains a single unit test class with one test function. The file does not define any classes or functions, but rather contains a single unit test that verifies the correctness of the addition operation.\\n\\n`ExampleUnitTest`: A unit test class that contains a single test case to verify the correctness of the addition operation.\\n\\n`addition_isCorrect()`: A test function that checks if the addition of 2 and 2 is equal to 4, which is the expected result.\",\"/app/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script for an Android application. It sets up the project configuration, including the Android application plugin, Kotlin support, and various dependencies. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather configures the build settings and dependencies for the Android application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/example/locationtracking/activity/MainActivity.kt\":\"This file appears to be an Android activity class that sets up the layout and handles window insets for the main activity of a location tracking application.\\n\\n`MainActivity`: An Android activity class that sets up the layout and handles window insets for the main activity of a location tracking application.\\n\\n`onCreate`: Initializes the activity, enables edge-to-edge mode, sets the content view, and sets up a listener to handle window insets and adjust the padding of the main view accordingly.\",\"/settings.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle configuration file for an Android project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather configures the project\\u0027s build settings and dependencies.\\n\\n`pluginManagement`: Configures the repositories for plugin dependencies, including Google, Maven Central, and the Gradle Plugin Portal.\\n\\n`dependencyResolutionManagement`: Configures the repositories for project dependencies, including Google and Maven Central, and sets the repositories mode to fail on project repositories.\\n\\n`rootProject.name`: Sets the name of the root project to \\\"Location Tracking\\\".\\n\\n`include(\\\":app\\\")`: Includes the \\\":app\\\" module in the project.\"}"}
